definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to enjoy watching a bustling scene/to go where the crowds are
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
while the connoisseur recognizes the artistry, the layman simply enjoys the show
pinyin: nei4 hang2 kan4 men2 dao5 , wai4 hang2 kan4 re4 nao5
containing_words.word: 内行看门道，外行看热闹

sentences.english: Dilettante watch the scene of bustle, adept guard the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 外行看热闹，内行看门道。

sentences.english: The"Madding Crowd"conceals the deep sense of illusion and absurdity.
sentences.chinese: 热闹喧嚣的场面下，蕴涵着浓重的虚幻感和荒诞意识。

sentences.english: The political rally was souped up by the appearance of the candidates.
sentences.chinese: 这次政治集会由于各候选人的出席而显得更为热闹。

sentences.english: Carrie had noticed the appearance of gayety and pleasure-seeking in the streets which they were following.
sentences.chinese: 嘉莉注意到沿途那喜庆热闹和寻欢作乐的景象。

sentences.english: On any free time, she would have the obnoxiously busy job at the coffee shop across the street from campus.
sentences.chinese: 空余的时间会在学校对街热闹的咖啡店打工。

sentences.english: The welcome ceremony appears extremely busy, has the orchestra to play music, the firecrackers fireworks sound together.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎仪式显得热闹非凡，有乐队奏乐，鞭炮礼花齐鸣。

sentences.english: And eh grasshopper laughs in the merry scene.
sentences.chinese: 欢笑的蝈蝈儿不会在热闹里打瞌睡。

sentences.english: "Singles day" shindig is a popular form of urban youth celebrate.
sentences.chinese: “光棍节”的热闹聚会是都市青年流行的庆祝形式。

sentences.english: Mr Dedalus said. I was only vamping, man.
sentences.chinese: 迪达勒斯先生说，“伙计，我不过是凑凑热闹。”

sentences.english: There was more hoopla surrounding the introduction of incandescent lights than there seems to be surrounding compact fluorescents.
sentences.chinese: 当时，引进白炽灯可比引进紧凑荧光灯热闹许多。
当这些人失败的时候，那些看热闹的旁人会感到高兴。

sentences.english: The Ping-Pong tables, soda machines, and lots of music.
sentences.chinese: 乒乓球，汽水贩卖机，热闹的音乐。

sentences.english: It sat flush on Ninety-fifth Street in a mostly residential neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 它坐落在第九十五街一个热闹的住宅区。

sentences.english: As they were wouking , a couple of older bous stopped by to watch, "What are you doing ?"
sentences.chinese: 他们干得正欢的时，两个大孩子停在一边看热闹。

sentences.english: The first day is really lively, all the people go out for fun.
sentences.chinese: 第一天确实很热闹，所有的人都出来寻找乐子。

sentences.english: In short several days, wild goose battlement the street threw on noisy"Christmas load".
sentences.chinese: 短短几天内，雁城街头就披上了热闹的“圣诞装”。

definition: lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
